intro: Nemesia platysepala, commonly known as the flat-sepal nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers feature five fused sepals that give it its common name. Nemesia platysepala thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
